channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Sat, 31 Aug 2024 08:31:54 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'We need to protect people': Zelenskyy fires air force commander after deadly F-16 crash
item.description: Following the crash of an F-16 warplane during Russian bombardment, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed air force commander Lt General Mykola Oleshchuk. US experts are investigating the incident that resulted in the pilot’s death. Lt General Anatolii Kryvonozhko was appointed as the acting air force commander, and Zelenskyy emphasized the need to protect personnel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is US ready to accept the 2024 election outcome? Most Americans say yes, but poll shows Trump’s supporters have doubts
item.description: As the 2024 presidential election nears, a majority of Americans express readiness to accept the results, though divisions persist, especially regarding Trump. An ABC News/Ipsos poll shows that 81% are prepared to accept the outcome, but confidence in election accuracy and legitimacy varies significantly across political affiliations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US, Iraqi forces raid kills 15 IS operatives in Anbar desert
item.description: The US military, with Iraqi security forces, executed a raid in Western Iraq on August 29, killing 15 Islamic State militants. The mission aimed to thwart the militants' attack plans. Central command reported that the militants were armed and no civilian casualties were detected.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Massive blackout strikes Venezuela's capital, Maduro govt cries 'sabotage'
item.description: Venezuela faced a power blackout affecting the country's capital Caracas and other regions, with President Nicolás Maduro blaming opposition sabotage on the Guri Reservoir, the main hydroelectric project. The government said that rapid investigation is taking place. The power outage disrupted daily life including closing businesses and hospitals switching to backup power, but restoration efforts were underway by evening.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Explosive Trump biopic to hit US theaters before election: Reports
item.description: A controversial biopic of Donald Trump that depicts the former president raping his wife and which has drawn legal threats from his attorneys will hit US theaters this October, it was reported Friday. The news comes on the same day "Reagan," another biopic of a former Republican president, Ronald Reagan, hits US theaters.

item.title: Bus stabbing in Germany: Woman attacks five in latest incident of violence in Siegen
item.description: A woman stabbed and wounded five people in a bus in western Germany on Friday, police said, one week after a deadly knife attack that shook the country. Germany was rocked by a stabbing attack one week ago that left three people dead and eight wounded in the western city of Solingen.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump calls Kamala Harris 'defective person' at Moms for Liberty conference
item.description: At the Moms for Liberty conference, former President Donald Trump criticized Vice President Kamala Harris, calling her a 'defective person.' The event aimed to galvanize support among Trump's base, focusing on conservative education policies. Trump addressed issues like school choice and transgender athletes, while also criticizing the Biden administration’s education approach.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Decades after independence, France-Algeria ties still tense
item.description: Tensions between France and Algeria have deepened after French President Macron's endorsement of Morocco's Western Sahara autonomy plan, causing Algeria to withdraw its ambassador and reschedule Tebboune's state visit to France. The strained relations also revolve around unresolved historical grievances from French colonization, economic issues, and Algeria's demands for reparations.

item.title: Matthew Perry death: Doctor charged in 'Friends' actor's death barred from practicing medicine, set to plead guilty
item.description: Dr Mark Chavez faces charges in connection with Matthew Perry's ketamine overdose death. He appeared in a Los Angeles court, is set to plead guilty, and has surrendered his medical license. This case involves multiple participants, including another doctor and an alleged drug supplier, highlighting a broader investigation into drug distribution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I’ll be voting no': Why did Trump reverse his position on Florida's abortion measure?
item.description: Former President Donald Trump has stated he will vote against Florida's Amendment 4, which seeks to expand abortion access. He criticized Florida’s current six-week abortion ban, calling it a mistake. His stance follows backlash from social conservatives, emphasizing the political challenges he faces regarding reproductive rights and his complex position on the issue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Musk calls Brazil’s SC judge ‘evil dictator’ after X gets the axe
item.description: Elon Musk's social media platform, X, has been ordered to suspend its operations in Brazil by the Supreme Court, with Justice Alexandre de Moraes leading the efforts against disinformation. Musk criticized the move, calling it a threat to democracy. This follows months of tension and legal challenges, including defiance over appointing a new legal representative.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: BLA terror attacks may delay launch of China-backed airport in Pakistan
item.description: The inauguration of a Chinese-funded airport in Balochistan, Pakistan, has been postponed for a security review after recent separatist attacks left over 70 dead. Planned for August 14, the event was called off amid protests by an ethnic Baloch rights group. Authorities are reassessing regional security as military operations target suspected insurgents.

item.title: Japan scraps idea to woo women out of city with cash
item.description: A widely ridiculed Japanese government idea to woo Tokyo women into marrying men in rural areas by offering cash payouts and train tickets to matchmaking events has been scrapped, officials said Friday. Hanako Jimi, minister of state for regional revitalisation, said Friday she had instructed officials to "review" the plan, and insisted that reports about the size of payments were "not true".

item.title: Brazilian supreme court orders suspension of X amid feud with Elon Musk
item.description: Elon Musk's social media platform, X, has been suspended in Brazil by a supreme court justice after Musk refused to appoint a local representative. Internet service providers and app stores have five days to block access, and fines will be imposed for VPN usage. The suspension stems from ongoing disputes over compliance with court orders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Yunus to meet political party reps today
item.description: Muhammad Yunus, the interim government chief adviser of Bangladesh, is set to meet with various political parties at Jamuna State Guest House in Dhaka on Saturday afternoon. The series of meetings will take place from 3pm to 8pm. This follows a BNP delegation urging Yunus to start comprehensive dialogues about state reforms and elections.

item.title: In 1st outreach, Sharif dials Yunus, stresses need to revitalise ties
item.description: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif contacted Bangladesh's chief adviser Muhammad Yunus, marking the first direct high-level engagement since the Dhaka government change. They agreed on enhancing regional cooperation and revitalizing bilateral relations. Sharif emphasized commercial ties, cultural exchanges, and people-to-people contact. He also offered support following Bangladesh's recent flood devastation and expressed a commitment to mutual prosperity.

item.title: Venezuela faces widespread power outage; interior minister blames 'terrorist attack'
item.description: Venezuela encountered a widespread power outage, which the government attributed to sabotage against line 765, affecting various states. Interior Minister Diosdado Cabello termed it a terrorist attack. The Maduro administration holds opposition sectors responsible. This development comes amid mass protests over President Maduro's contentious electoral win, calling for election transparency.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Raleigh sets record for hottest August 29, with 101 degrees
item.description: Raleigh has seen a record-breaking temperature of 101 degrees on August 29th, surpassing the previous high set in 1948. The National Weather Service warns of potential evening storms with damaging winds. Highs will drop to the 90s by Friday with isolated storms possible over the weekend. Temperatures may further decrease to the 70s and 50s next week.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Xi's Communist Party tightens behaviour rules for its members
item.description: China's Communist Party, led by President Xi Jinping, has implemented new rules targeting members who lack revolutionary spirit and fail to meet performance standards. The 27-article regulations aim to ensure the party's integrity and self-reform for its nearly 100 million members, as reported by state-run Xinhua.

item.title: Houthi-hit tanker posing danger to Red Sea
item.description: The MV Delta Sounion, a Greek oil tanker, has been immobilised in the Red Sea after an attack by Houthi rebels. Carrying 1 million barrels of crude oil, it now poses a severe environmental hazard due to ongoing fires. The Greek-flagged tanker was travelling from Iraq to Greece, with its crew safely evacuated to Djibouti.
